page.title: 19TRANSPORT Pentney & Narboro'
page.content: Less public transport exists in the area now than formerly, the railway discontinued in 1968 and less buses run. Thus all age groups rely more upon cars, motorcycles and bicycles. This poses a problem for two different age groups; the elderly who once owned a car but due to changed circumstances now find it necessary to rely on public transport. The other group are the young workers who are unable to afford their own transport. The A47, the main trunk road through the area, is in reasonable condition but the byroads leave much to be desired. Sharp bends on the A47 at Narborough and heavy traffic, often moving too fast, have resulted in many accidents over the years. A By Pass has long been talked about but despite an official inquiry, no definite route has yet been planned.
